summary:
* Texas-LCSW-S (specialty supervisor status effective: 10/16/2020) TBHEC License #50103-Control #1171268 - active - 7/22/06-6/30/24
* Texas-LCDC, ADC - License #14960 - Control #47109 - active-1/15/19-7/31/23
* Rhode Island-LiCSW-ISW03429 (LiCSW effective: 11/29/2021) - active- 06/14/11-05/01/25
* Texas Teacher Certifícate - Elementary and Bilingual/ESL (PK-6th) - 1/6/1997 - LIFE
* Eye Movement Desensitization & Reprocessing (EMDR) trained (2021): 20 hrs didactic instruction, 20 hrs practicum, and 10 hrs consultation. Additional training for patients dx w/Schizophrenia and DID (2022).
* Dialectical Behavioral Therapy (DBT) Intensive Training completed (2018): 72 CEU classroom hours of General Overview (16), Individual (32), and group skills (32) 
* Masters Degree: University of Houston GSSW - Political Social Work and Children & Families 
* Bachelors Degree: Mount Holyoke College - Major: Neuroscience (Psychology and Biology double-major) - Minor: Chemistry
* Multilingual & multicultural: Born in Santiago, Chile. Able to read, write and speak in Spanish. Can speak and understand French, and understand Portuguese.
* Computer proficient: Microsoft Office Word, Excel, Visio, Adobe. Typing – 78 wpm 99% accuracy
* Independent, works well in groups, self-driven, active listener, solution centered, caring and tenacious worker.

message.text:
The world population is 8.1 billion (8,100,000,000)humans and Mother Earth’s 🌎 Total Surface Area is about 197 million square miles, where only 29% of it is land, or about 57 million (57,268,900square miles), because 71% of the Earth is water. If we were to divide the land evenly, assuming every inch is inhabitable and not thinking that there are OTHER species of creatures living on Mother Earth 🌍 too, that calculates to: 0.071 square miles per person or 45 acres per person.

All the world wars are about real estate. Please allow women to have power over their reproductive organs. Our bodies… our rights… our decision.

The fertility rate in the United States has been trending down for decades, and a new report shows that another drop in births in 2023 brought the rate down to the lowest it’s been in more than century.

There were about 3.6 million babies born in 2023, or 54.4 live births for every 1,000 females ages 15 to 44, according to provisional data from the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention’s National Center for Health Statistics. 

After a steep plunge in the first year of the Covid-19 pandemic, the fertility rate has fluctuated. But the 3% drop between 2022 and 2023 brought the rate just below the previous low from 2020, which was 56 births for every 1,000 women of reproductive age. Here's the latest: https://lnkd.in/g9CCrWBh
Being kind is free. Remember to be kind

The world is awesome 

🌺 Lotsa angels are out there making it better 
🌺 They might not necessarily have wings🪽, or come in a shape, size or color you think, 
🌺 But they are out there making this world a better place.
🌺 So cling on to hope, a miracle is on its way.
🌺 Let’s end this weekend with gratitude and smile😊

#happinessisachoice #smile #nevergiveup

commentary.text:
Televero Health Yes, I agree. As a trauma informed therapist, I focus daily on sustainable living of the children after they are born and children in their environment (home, school, etc), respecting each human and doing my best, at a micro level, to help secure their basic human needs: water, food, shelter, access to mental health and medical needs, gas, electricity, hot & cold potable water, safety, healthy relationships, clothing, and education to name a few items.

Each child born is to be celebrated and supported.

This isn’t necessary “bad” news. This, in my opinion, this is how our species is responding to our environment around us.

The world population is 8.1 billion (8,100,000,000)humans and Mother Earth’s 🌎 Total Surface Area is about 197 million square miles, where only 29% of it is land, or about 57 million (57,268,900square miles), because 71% of the Earth is water. If we were to divide the land evenly, assuming every inch is inhabitable and not thinking that there are OTHER species of creatures living on Mother Earth 🌍 too, that calculates to: 0.071 square miles per person or 45 acres per person.

I say this because all of our worldwide wars are about real estate.
Yay Dr. Melville! 👏👏👏 An incredibly intelligent and capable professional and a really kind and personable person as well.
